theory_content: Saving is essential, but keeping all your money in a traditional savings account is a losing strategy due to **Inflation**. If your savings interest rate is 2% and inflation is 5%, your money is losing 3% of its real value every year. [Image of inflation chart showing price of an item increasing over 20 years]

Investing is the act of allocating capital to an asset (stocks, bonds, real estate) with the expectation of generating a profit or return over time. The primary goal is to have your money **grow faster than the rate of inflation**.

The **Opportunity Cost** of saving instead of investing is the potential growth you miss out on. By holding large sums in low-yield accounts, you miss the opportunity for those funds to benefit from long-term market growth.
